at.ac.tuwien.ims.svn.phantasmophobia

Class GameLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • at.ac.tuwien.ims.svn.phantasmophobia.GameLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameLoop
extends java.lang.Thread
    Created by Carla Jancik on 24.10.2015. tutorial for framerateindependency http://obviam.net/index.php/the-android-game-loop/ if you want to display your game with 30 fps, one frame will need 1000/30 milliseconds to update and render because some frames take longer/shorter and differnt devices have different capacities, you need to handle framerate independency if a frame updates and renders too fast, just put the thread to sleep for the remaining time. if a frame takes too long, skip the next frame and update instead. then update and render the next frame. this will also give some rest to your cpu.,
